title: Get Default Profile
name: Get_Default_Profile
description: Get the default ingest profile for the account.

examples.title: Get Default Profile Example:
examples.content: https://ingestion.api.brightcove.com/v1/accounts/57838016001/configuration

200.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
maximum number of custom profiles for the account

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "date_created": 1442409154636,
    "date_last_modified": 1442409154636,
    "default_live_profile_id": "Live - Standard",
    "default_profile_id": "screencast-1280",
    "id": "55525f84e4b08e946aa03281",
    "max_profile_count": 10,
    "max_rendition_count": 20,
    "version": 1442409154636
}

Error 4xx.description: 401: Credentials are required to access this resource
404: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

examples.title: 409 Error Response
404 Error Response
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 404 NOT_FOUND Error 404 NOT_FOUND

HTTP ERROR 404

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/configurtion. Reason: 

 NOT_FOUND

title: Set Default Profile
name: Set_Default_Profile
description: Sets an ingest profile as the default for the account.

Request Body Fields.description: Video Cloud account ID
The id or name of the profile you want to set as the default
The id or name of the live profile you want to set as the default

examples.title: Set Default Profile Example:

200.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
maximum number of custom profiles for the account

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "date_created": 1443727850896,
    "date_last_modified": 1443727850896,
    "default_live_profile_id": "Live - Standard",
    "default_profile_id": "high-resolution",
    "id": "55525f84e4b08e946aa03281",
    "max_profile_count": 10,
    "max_rendition_count": 20,
    "version": 1443727850896
}

Error 4xx.description: 401: Credentials are required to access this resource.
404: The api couldn't find the resource you requested
400: The JSON was not valid
409: Account configuration already exists for 57838016001; please delete the configuration first, or update it instead.

404 Error Response
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 404 NOT_FOUND Error 404 NOT_FOUND

HTTP ERROR 404

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/configurtion. Reason: 

 NOT_FOUND

title: Update Default Profile

The id or name of the profile you want to set as the default
The id or name of the live profile you want to set as the default

200.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
maximum number of custom profiles for the account

title: Create Ingest Profile
name: Create_Ingest_Profile
description: Create a custom ingest profile for the account. Note that you can also do this through Video Cloud Studio

Request Body Fields.description: profile name (must be unique within the account)
Video Cloud account ID.
description of the profile
specification for archiving a master
rendition to use as master - either passthrough (the source optimized for online delivery) or none if you do not want to archive a master
whether to make the master playable as a rendition by pushing it to the CDN(s)
specification for renditions and images - Dynamic Delivery and CAE profiles only
names of audio and video renditions to include (audio only for CAE profiles) - see Standard Ingest Profiles - renditions for available renditions you can choose from
names of video renditions for Fast Publish (only for CAE profiles) - see Standard Ingest Profiles - renditions for available renditions you can choose from
array of image specifications for poster and thumbnail (if omitted, no images will be captured during ingestion)
the kind of image this will be
the height of the image in pixels
the width of the image in pixels
Defines rendition options for CAE profiles only
Minimum number of renditions to create for CAE profiles only
Maximum number of renditions to create for CAE profiles only
Defines the minimum resolution for for CAE profiles only renditions
Minimum height for renditions for CAE profiles only
Minimum width for renditions for CAE profiles only
Defines the maximum resolution for renditions for CAE profiles only
Maximum height for renditions for CAE profiles only
Maximum width for renditions for CAE profiles only
Maximum bitrate for renditions in kbps for CAE profiles only
Maximum bitrate for lowest bitrate rendition in kbps for CAE profiles only
Maximum framerate for renditions in fps for CAE profiles only
The number of keyframes per second for renditions (So a value of 0.5 would result in one keyframe every two seconds; a value of 3 would result in three keyframes per second) for CAE profiles only
At least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile for CAE profiles only
array of rendition maps Legacy Ingest only
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio Legacy Ingest only
audio bitrate in kbps Legacy Ingest only
number of audio channels Legacy Ingest only
audio codec, e.g. aac Legacy Ingest only
max aaic profile - aac-lc is the recommended value Legacy Ingest only
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding Legacy Ingest only
1-51, not used by default. Legacy Ingest only
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder Legacy Ingest only
encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128 Legacy Ingest only
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments Legacy Ingest only
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes â€” NOTE overrides keyframe_interval Legacy Ingest only
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used Legacy Ingest only
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images Legacy Ingest only
frame rate in frames per second Legacy Ingest only
number of bframes for h.264 Legacy Ingest only
h.264 profile level Legacy Ingest only
h.264 profile Legacy Ingest only
number of h.264 reference frames to use Legacy Ingest only
Time segments optimized for HLS Legacy Ingest only
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate) Legacy Ingest only
Maximum number of keyframes per second Legacy Ingest only
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions Legacy Ingest only
Whether this will be for live streaming video Legacy Ingest only
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds) Legacy Ingest only
Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only) Legacy Ingest only
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate Legacy Ingest only
the media type of the rendition Legacy Ingest only
force one-pass encoding Legacy Ingest only
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging Legacy Ingest only
number of seconds of content to include in segments (the default for HLS is 10; for DASH: 2) Legacy Ingest only
A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output Legacy Ingest only
the minimum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only
the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only
the minimum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only
the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only
if true the source must include an audio track Legacy Ingest only
if true the source must include a video track Legacy Ingest only
the source must be at least this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "400x225") Legacy Ingest only
the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080") Legacy Ingest only
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions Legacy Ingest only
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features Legacy Ingest only
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory Legacy Ingest only
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile Legacy Ingest only
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented Legacy Ingest only
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target Legacy Ingest only
target video bitrate in kbps Legacy Ingest only
target video codec Legacy Ingest only
target frame height in pixels Legacy Ingest only
target frame width in pixels Legacy Ingest only
array of watermark maps Legacy Ingest only
URL for the watermark image Legacy Ingest only
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the right edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the bottom edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security) Legacy Ingest only
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"] Legacy Ingest only
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine Legacy Ingest only
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's Legacy Ingest only

examples.title: Create Profile Example - Dynamic Delivery:

200.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
rendition that will be used as master (passthrough = source optimized for online delivery)
whether source is available for playback as a rendition
audio and video renditions to be created
maximum bitrate for the lowest bitrate rendition
whether at least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding â€” this field is not relevant for h.264 video and will be ignored
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output
the minimum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the minimum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
if true the source must include an audio track
if true the source must include a video track
the source must be at least this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "400x225")
the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080")
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10%
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "brightcove_standard": false,
    "date_created": 1443700501852,
    "date_last_modified": 1443700501852,
    "description": "This will produce 1 HLS rendition and 2 image renditions.",
    "digital_master": {
        "distribute": true,
        "rendition": "passthrough"
    },
    "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c4",
    "name": "Protected",
    "packages": [],
    "renditions": [
        {
            "audio_bitrate": 96,
            "audio_codec": "aac",
            "format": "ts",
            "h264_profile": "main",
            "height": 720,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c1",
            "keyframe_rate": 0.5,
            "max_frame_rate": 30.0,
            "media_type": "video",
            "reference_id": "ts1",
            "type": "segmented",
            "video_codec": "h264",
            "width": 1280
        },
        {
            "format": "png",
            "height": 540,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c2",
            "label": "poster",
            "media_type": "image",
            "width": 960
        },
        {
            "format": "png",
            "height": 90,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c3",
            "label": "thumbnail",
            "media_type": "image",
            "width": 160
        }
    ],
    "version": 1443700501853
}

Error 4xx.description: 400: Invalid JSON â€” message varies according to the problem
409: Could not create profile with this name and id (profile name or id already exists)
422: required field missing â€” message varies according to the issue
401: Credentials are required to access this resource.
404: Resource not found

 Unrecognized token 'true': was expecting 'null', 'true', 'false' or NaN

examples.content:

 rendition list contains duplicate reference ID: ts1 (through reference chain: com.brightcove.profiles.common.model.Profile["renditions"])

title: Update Ingest Profile
name: Update_Ingest_Profile
description: Update an existing ingest profile - the existing profile will be deactivated, and replaced by the one specified in the request body

Request Body Fields.description: profile name (must be unique within the account)
Video Cloud account ID.
description of the profile
specification for archiving a master
rendition to use as master - either passthrough (the source optimized for online delivery) or none if you do not want to archive a master
whether to make the master playable as a rendition by pushing it to the CDN(s)
specification for renditions and images
names of audio and video renditions to include - see Standard Ingest Profiles - renditions for available renditions you can choose from
array of image specifications for poster and thumbnail (if omitted, no images will be captured during ingestion)
the kind of image this will be
the height of the image in pixels
the width of the image in pixels
Defines rendition options for CAE profiles
Minimum number of renditions to create
Maximum number of renditions to create
Defines the minimum resolution for renditions
Minimum height for renditions
Minimum width for renditions
Defines the maximum resolution for renditions
Maximum height for renditions
Maximum width for renditions
Maximum bitrate for renditions in kbps
Maximum bitrate for lowest bitrate rendition in kbps
Maximum framerate for renditions in fps
The number of keyframes per second for renditions (So a value of 0.5 would result in one keyframe every two seconds; a value of 3 would result in three keyframes per second)
At least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile
array of rendition maps
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
audio bitrate in kbps
number of audio channels
audio codec, e.g. aac
max aaic profile - aac-lc is the recommended value
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding
1-51, not used by default.
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes â€” NOTE overrides keyframe_interval
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
frame rate in frames per second
number of bframes for h.264
h.264 profile level
h.264 profile
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Time segments optimized for HLS
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Maximum number of keyframes per second
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
the media type of the rendition
force one-pass encoding
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
number of seconds of content to include in segments (the default for HLS is 10; for DASH: 2)
A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output
the minimum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the minimum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)
if true the source must include an audio track
if true the source must include a video track
the source must be at least this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "400x225")
the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080")
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target
target video bitrate in kbps
target video codec
target frame height in pixels
target frame width in pixels
array of watermark maps
URL for the watermark image
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted

distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the right edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted

distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the bottom edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

examples.title: Update Profile Example:
examples.content:
{
  "account_id": "57838016001",
  "name": "Protected",
  "description": "This will produce 1 HLS rendition and 2 image renditions.",
  "renditions": [
    {
      "media_type": "video",
      "reference_id": "ts1",
      "format": "ts",
      "type": "segmented",
      "audio_codec": "aac",
      "audio_bitrate": 96,
      "video_codec": "h264",
      "keyframe_rate": 0.5,
      "max_frame_rate": 30,
      "width": 1280,
      "height": 720,
      "h264_profile": "main"
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "poster",
      "width": 960,
      "height": 540
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "thumbnail",
      "width": 160,
      "height": 90
    }
  ],
  "digital_master": {
        "rendition": "passthrough",
        "distribute": true
    },
  "packages": []
}

200.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
rendition that will be used as master (passthrough = source optimized for online delivery)
whether source is available for playback as a rendition
audio and video renditions to be created
maximum bitrate for the lowest bitrate rendition
whether at least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding â€” this field is not relevant for h.264 video and will be ignored
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output

the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080")
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented

distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10%
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
